In round 1, only Seeker_A has applied to us, but Seeker_B ranks Company_A 3rd and Seeker_D ranks Company_A 2nd, so there is a reasonable chance either may approach us in upcoming rounds. With quota 1, accepting Seeker_A now would foreclose the possibility of matching with a higher-priority candidate. Given we can reject now and still pursue higher-ranked seekers later, the optimal move to maximize our outcome is to reject Seeker_A at this time.

Given seeker preferences, Seeker_C ranks Company_C 4th and may not approach us early; Seeker_B ranks Company_C last, so is unlikely to approach us. This increases the risk of holding out. Still, we prefer a higher-priority match and can reject now to preserve the slot, hoping to attract Seeker_C later or at least reconsider in later rounds if needed. Therefore, reject Seeker_D this round to keep capacity for higher-ranked candidates.
